description: From Middle French aduste, and its source, Latin adustus (“burnt, scorched”), past participle of adūrere.

entries.meaning: (medicine, historical, usually postpositive) Of a bodily humour: abnormally dark or over-concentrated (associated with various states of discomfort or illness, specifically being too hot or dry). [from 15th c.]
(by extension) Hot and dry; thirsty or parched.
(archaic) Burnt or having a scorched colour. [from 15th c.]
